item.title: Vaccine Tracker: May 22
item.description: Use vaccines as an aphrodisiac: In partnership with the White House, popular dating apps including Hinge, Tinder, OkCupid, and Bumble will soon introduce features that allow users to a) broadcast they‚Äôve been vaccinated and b) find other vaccinated singles who are down to dose-si-do.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Make It Work: Recruiting Takeover¬†
item.description: When you apply and are asked about your current company/role, my suggestion would be to reference notable companies, brands, or clients you work with along with the less-recognizable name of the smaller company you work for. is a question I get asked in every interview. ¬†You can always check the Glassdoor profile of a company you‚Äôre applying to, but take it with a grain of salt since reviews on there can sometimes be really old. Everyone says working for a small company/startup leads to valuable skills, but many recruiters may not recognize the company's name.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Meme Battle: Classy Winnie the Pooh
item.description: We'll pick a new memelord in next week's Sunday Edition and provide you with another meme template to meme-ify.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: How to Not Get (Totally) Ripped Off When Ordering Wine
item.description: They analyzed the prices of 6,335 wines at 249 London restaurants to understand how wine markups at restaurants really work. And for the rest of us who order the average-priced wine of the list... Much has been said about the pitfalls of ordering the second-cheapest bottle of wine on a menu. ¬†What they found: People who order the second-cheapest bottle of wine are in fact not being ripped off more than anyone else. The wines in the middle of the menu, the Pittsburgh Pirates of the wine world, have the highest percentage markup. You pick up the wine men‚Äîer, scan the QR code to pull up the wine list. ¬† So how are wine menus priced?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Icebreakers With...Aparicio Giddins
item.description: The book that I read in college that made me want to start a bank was Rich Dad, Poor Dad.What's a song that can always pump you up? Aparicio Giddins is the president and chief technology officer of Greenwood Financial, a new banking platform for Black and Latino customers. What new ways of doing things will you keep from this past year? I want to make sure that I continue getting outdoors because it really is beautiful out there. This interview was lightly edited and condensed for clarity. It's a shame I've been stuck in a concrete building for the last 20 years.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Robinhood Now Offering IPO Shares
item.description: The guinea pig: Figs, a maker of medical scrubs, became the first company to offer IPO shares on Robinhood when it went public yesterday, reserving 1% of its 22.5 million shares for Robinhood users. Companies popped an average of 36% on their first day of trading in 2020, per Dealogic.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Oatly IPOs at $12B valuation
item.description: But the company didn't become a household name until Petersson took over as CEO in 2014, refreshing Oatly's visual identity and reframing its marketing around oat milk's health and environmental benefits. Yesterday, shares in Oatly, the world's biggest oat milk maker, soared 19% in its IPO, valuing the company at a trenta-sized $12 billion. In the oat department alone, Oatly's got competition from Califia Farms, Chobani, Planet Oat, Pacific, and Danone's legacy alternative milk brands, Alpro and Silk. oat milk? But oat milk is still second fiddle to almond milk. Their bet is paying off.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: In finance, 'people of color are shut out before they ever get in'
item.description: There just aren't that many people of color in finance, even in New York City. Now we in finance are starting to pay attention to diversity. There are more of us now‚Äîmaybe because banks realized sitting in a room with¬†only¬†15 white men was a bad look. People of color are shut out before they ever get in. Do I talk to the seven people of color who work in finance? It's just you, the only woman on the floor and one of the few people of color on the floor. When Wells Fargo's CEO says he can't find qualified people of color when I personally have them reaching out to me on LinkedIn every day? I had friends of color from college who happened to be in the finance industry¬†In speaking to my friends of color in different parts of the finance industry, our experiences were analogous. I think the finance industry wants to change. Maybe there aren't¬†seven¬†Black people anymore, but¬†eight. You feel like you work harder than your coworkers with no recognition." I had a friend of color in my cohort and we were among the only people who got the job based on our interviews and credentials, and not who our family was, or who knew someone. We're hardly giving those same chances to people of color. Just to get me in the stadium, essentially. It's so hard to get your foot in the door. You're not seeing the fruits of your labor. In 2015 I received a new manager¬†who happened to be a¬†white man. Sure, there were one or two other Black men, but trying to fit into the culture‚Äîthe culture of white people, to be frank‚Äîwas difficult. There was one woman at my bank, more senior, who I could talk to as a kind of mentor. You can see the change¬†particularly when there are industry happy hours and events. But it¬†can be a hard few months or years. I don't know. I'm sure my story is not unique for people of color in finance.
item.author: Sandrine Maurice

The relocation of the Whitney Museum in 2015, the High Line park, and Google's expansion in Chelsea have dramatically changed the area in the last decade.

item.title: Oatly IPOs at $12B valuation
item.description: Yesterday, shares in Oatly, the world's biggest oat milk maker, soared 19% in its IPO, valuing the company at a trenta-sized $12 billion. In the oat department alone, Oatly's got competition from Califia Farms, Chobani, Planet Oat, Pacific, and Danone's legacy alternative milk brands, Alpro and Silk. oat milk? But the company didn't become a household name until Petersson took over as CEO in 2014, refreshing Oatly's visual identity and reframing the company‚Äôs marketing around oat milk's health and environmental benefits. ¬† But oat milk is still second fiddle to almond milk. Their bet is paying off.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Air Travel Already Surging Before EU‚Äôs Reopening Announcement
item.description: Back stateside: While some American travelers are waiting for the final EU approval that will likely come later this month or next before booking international flights, US domestic travel has already taken off. United added 400 new domestic and international flights to July‚Äôs schedule to prepare for the expected surge in summer travels.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: F-150 Lightning: A Lot Riding on Ford‚Äôs First All-Electric Truck
item.description: In an extravagant event last night, Ford officially unveiled its all-electric F-150 Lightning. Since many Americans may view EVs as the domain of the Berkeley crowd, Ford hopes that an electric version of the ubiquitous F-150 could change perceptions.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Cryptocurrencies Including Bitcoin, Ethereum Plunge In Value
item.description: PwC‚Äôs global head of crypto Henri Arslanian: ‚ÄúI would not be surprised to see other regulators and policymakers do the same [as the Chinese restrictions] over the coming weeks as they warn investors over the risks of speculative trading or crypto market volatility.‚Äù ¬†Some other reasons investors could be hopping off the crypto coaster:¬†New investors in the space may have learned Monday that the IRS treats cryptocurrency as property, not currency, and taxes it as such. But yesterday, amid the market chaos, Musk confirmed his overall support for bitcoin with a tweet: ‚ÄúTesla has üíé üôå‚Äù¬†On a crazy day for crypto, everyone had something to sayLet‚Äôs pass the mic...
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Internet Explorer Gets Edged Out
item.description: In 2013, Google Chrome overtook Internet Explorer as the most popular browser in the US and hasn‚Äôt looked back. According to NetMarketShare, Chrome owns 69% of the market, Edge 7.8%, Firefox 7.5%, and Internet Explorer 5.2%.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: May 20
item.description: (ProPublica) Read: Hundreds of PPP loans went to fake farms in absurd places.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Why Banking With Greenwood Is About More Than the Money
item.description: In March, Greenwood raised a $40 million Series A from Truist Bank, Bank of America, and JPMorgan Chase, and most recently, Greenwood partnered with Mastercard to create its first debit card and other educational resources for customers. Greenwood Financial‚Äôs founders were inspired by the prosperity of the Greenwood District. Greenwood‚Äôs fully digital platform allows people to bank with them from all over the country, specifically in areas that have been shunned by traditional banks, known as bank deserts. But it‚Äôs not just about making Greenwood‚Äôs services accessible; its users have to trust it, which means reframing the fraught relationship between the US financial institutions and Black Americans. And Greenwood, we're making the Black version of that movie.‚Äù As of last June, only 0.2% of all banks regulated by the FDIC were Black-owned, and the number of Black-owned banks has been cut in half since 2001. In the early 1900s, the Greenwood District of Tusla, Oklahoma‚Äîoften referred to as Black Wall Street‚Äîwas home to a thriving Black business community. ¬†‚ÄúYou can get Apple Pay and Google Pay, you can get a savings account, a spending account, and you can go to the ATM. The digital banking platform is designed specifically for Black and Latino customers who have historically been denied access to credit and other financial services at much higher rates than white customers. Giddins mentions Italian-American Amadeo Giannini who founded Bank of America, at the time called ‚ÄúBank of Italy,‚Äù in 1904 as a way to provide loans to immigrants who were denied by major financial institutions.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Amazon Reportedly Negotiating $9B Acquisition of MGM Studios
item.description: AT&T's WarnerMedia just confirmed that it‚Äôs merging with Discovery into a $120+ billion entertainment giant next year. ¬†Zoom out: News of a potential MGM acquisition comes against the backdrop of an increasingly competitive streaming landscape.

item.title: IEA Sets out 400+ Step Plan to Reach 2050 Climate Goals
item.description: ¬†So the IEA went full Leslie Knope and released 400+ milestones for governments, including... And, based on existing national targets, the IEA estimates that by 2050 there will still be 22 billion tons of CO2 emissions. In a halftime speech for the ages, the International Energy Agency released a major report yesterday urging countries to go out there and score their 2050 climate goals. The gameplanSome countries have taken big steps‚ÄîDenmark pledged an end to new fossil fuel exploration, the UK is phasing out new sales of gas-powered vehicles.

item.title: 8 Charts that Explore Racial Disparities in the Banking Industry
item.description: Let's break it down by genderWhile there were more than 2x the number of Black women working in financial services at the professional level than Black men in 2018, their representation at the top was lower: 1.4% of executive/senior officials are Black men compared to 1.3% of Black women. Francis Scialabba But at the tippy top, <4% of the top managers identified as Black at most big banks. The presence of fewer Black banks can have an impact on local communities, the Urban Institute writes:¬†"As technology has allowed larger banks to deepen their market penetration without the need for physical branches, physical community bank branches are often the last defense between a community and banking isolation. Francis Scialabba That lack of capital has been a big constraint on many Black banks' abilities to lend and expand. Black banks are a small piece of the pieWhile the dollar value of assets held by all MDIs increased more than 3.5x over the last two decades, the share held by Black banks has fallen to <2% the total. At the end of 2020, there were just 20 Black banks. you know the drillThe average share of Black employees classified at the first/mid level at those same banks was 6.9%. ¬†On average, Black workers accounted for 7.9% of professional workers. You can find the remaining 20 Black banks... Francis Scialabba Black banks typically practice relationship banking: a more consultative approach that involves getting to know a customer and their needs and offering a variety of products and services. Across their total employee base, four‚ÄîJPMorgan, Bank of America, PNC, and Capital One‚Äîhad a 13% or greater share of Black employees (similar to the population at large, in which Black Americans were last estimated at 13.4%). Black banks have a longevity and capital problem. Wall Street's not the only streetOne way the US government has tried to narrow the racial wealth gap is by supporting Black-owned banks. Wall Street has a diversity problem.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: NYC Subways Now Open 24/7 After Year of Late Night Closure
item.description: Public transit systems in cities such as Chicago, DC, and LA were also hit hard during the pandemic.

item.title: New Study Finds Overworking Causes Hundreds of Thousands of Death Every Year
item.description: That 2016 part. Bottom line:¬†If you needed a final push to close your laptop while the sun is still out, let this be it: People who work 55+ hours a week have a 35% higher risk of stroke and 17% higher risk of dying from heart disease, says the WHO.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Are Elon Musk's Crypto Tweets Legal?
item.description: ¬†While Tesla's initial embrace of bitcoin was a major stamp of legitimacy for the crypto, the CEO's comments are now fueling critics' argument that cryptocurrency is too volatile." This past weekend, they fell after he replied to a tweet implying that Tesla may have sold its bitcoin holdings (Musk later said Tesla didn't). Tesla lawyers now vet any tweets containing any information "material to the company." then tanked 17% this month when Musk tweeted that Tesla was changing course. Elon Musk impersonators have scammed investors out of $2+ million worth of cryptocurrency in the last six months, according to the Federal Trade Commission.
item.author: Alex Hickey
